page.title: 08Crops Grown Around Coddenham
page.content: Farming in East Anglia has been a major industry for centuries. The rich soil and reasonably flat surfaces make the growing of corns and vegetables the most profitable usage of land. The eleven farms in our grid use the fertile soil to grow Winter Barley, Winter Wheat, Spring Barley, Oilweed Rape, Apples and Sugar Beet. Most farmers now use large machines and very little labour on their farms. Sowing and harvesting have become jobs for one man and one machine. Most farms are mixed i.e. farmers keep livestock as well as cultivate the land. Pigs, battery hens, milking cows and beef cattle all can be found in our area. All farmers are very much aware of conservation and wildlife is protected as much as possible with some of the land left as woodland and pastureland.
